name: Poly Multisample (legacy)
description: This algorithm is inspired by the original 'SD Multisample' algorithm on the disting EX. It is a polyphonic, multitimbral, sample playback instrument, playing WAV files from the MicroSD card. It can be played via CV/gate, MIDI, or I2C and supports both velocity switches and round robins per sample.
use_cases: Playing WAV files from MicroSD card via CV/gate, MIDI, or I2C
Polyphonic sound generation with up to four timbres and 16 voices
Adjusting tuning per timbre using semitones and cents
Volume envelope shaping (ADSR) for dynamic expression control
gui_description: The display shows the notes being played by the various voices, each superimposed on a bar indicating the note envelope. The folder and filename of the last sample played are also shown. When adjusting microtuning parameters, more information about the chosen tuning is displayed.

parameters.name: Global gain
parameters.description: A global gain adjustment applied to all timbres (in addition to their individual gains).

parameters.name: Sustain mode
parameters.description: The standard polysynth sustain mode parameter. See 'Common polysynth features' above.

parameters.name: Gate offset
parameters.description: Offsets (delays) the gate inputs relative to the pitch inputs. This is useful to allow pitch CVs to settle before they are sampled on the rising gate, and also to cope with modules which output both a pitch and gate but change their gate first.

parameters.name: Round robin mode
parameters.description: The round-robin mode. See 'Common polysynth features' above.

parameters.name: Folder
parameters.description: Sets the sample folder to use.

parameters.name: Gain
parameters.description: Sets the output level.

parameters.name: Pan
parameters.description: Sets the stereo pan position.

parameters.name: Transpose
parameters.description: Adjusts the tuning in semitones.

parameters.name: Fine tune
parameters.description: Adjusts the tuning in cents.

parameters.name: Envelope
parameters.description: Enables an ADSR volume envelope. If the envelope is disabled, the sample simply plays once until the end.

parameters.name: Attack
parameters.description: Sets the envelope attack time (from 1ms to 15s, exponential response).

parameters.name: Decay
parameters.description: Sets the envelope decay time (from 20ms to 15s, exponential response).

parameters.name: Sustain
parameters.description: Sets the envelope sustain level.

parameters.name: Release
parameters.description: Sets the envelope release time (from 10ms to 30s, exponential response).

parameters.name: Velocity
parameters.description: Sets the amount by which the note velocity affects the note volume.

parameters.name: Sustain (velocity)
parameters.description: Directly controls the sustain (like a MIDI sustain pedal).

parameters.name: MIDI channel
parameters.description: The MIDI channel to listen on.

parameters.name: MPE channels
parameters.description: Controls how the algorithm will respond to MPE. See 'Common polysynth features' above.

parameters.name: I2C channel
parameters.description: Sets the I2C channel.

parameters.name: Bend range
parameters.description: The MIDI pitch bend range.

input_ports.name: CV/gate input
input_ports.description: Pitch and gate CV inputs for triggering samples

input_ports.name: MIDI input
input_ports.description: MIDI note, velocity, and control messages (e.g., sustain)

input_ports.name: I2C input
input_ports.description: I2C communication interface for triggering samples

output_ports.name: Left/mono output bus
output_ports.description: Outputs audio signal to the left or mono channel

output_ports.name: Right output bus
output_ports.description: Outputs audio signal to the right channel

output_ports.name: Left/mono output
output_ports.description: The left or mono output bus.
